reviews.review_msg: General lack of compassion. Don't take this course if you care about yourself or others.

Nicky gives us opportunities to do well and is accessible for extra help. However, I find her to be abrupt, tough, and unapproachable especially in office hoursand I have seen her many times. I really wanted to love this class. I spoke with students and some felt the same (although some didnt, which is fair).

She has a strict grammar policy that punishes poor grammar and rewards perfect grammar. Got her to look at my essay for grammar, but still lost marks in areas that she looked over previously. Feedback is detailed but she doesnt like to explain herself in person.

Spoke with her before/after my assignments and felt that her attitude was dismissive. A student received a low grade because their attendance record was low. Attendance shouldnt affect an essay grade, but perhaps Im wrong. I feel that her marking is unfair. I have taken classes with difficult profs before and have always been successful.

Students can choose due dates, assignments, and marking schemes. She is available for help and incorporates various learning methods into the course. Although I am doing well right now (I havent taken the exam yet), I feel that office hours are a belittling and unhelpful experience. For these reasons, I do not recommend taking her class.

An excellent prof in terms of her organization and her concern for each person in the class.  She is very smart, and offers a unique marking scheme (you get to pick the assignments you want to be marked on).
